name: Informedika
overview:
That’s the real-life marriage that led to the founding of Informedika.

Steve Yaskin, a founder and CEO of several high-tech companies in Silicon Valley, had spent many years passionately solving problems using technology. In 2011 his attention turned to a problem that his wife, Dr. Yaskin, faced in her medical practice every single day – the astoundingly inefficient process of ordering diagnostic tests and dealing with the results.

Electronic prescribing (E-Prescribing) was already becoming widely accepted due to the greater efficiency and accuracy of an electronic prescription compared with a hand-written one. But lab and radiology requisitions were still being handled using the phone and fax machine – a time-consuming, error-prone, and frequently unreliable medium. As a result, Dr. Yaskin and her staff were wasting a huge amount of time addressing errors and confusion – time that could be spent on patient care. So, Steve thought, if we can have E-Prescribing, why not E-Requisitions?

Steve set out to bring diagnostics into the 21st century, and founded Informedika, Inc. As well as building an innovative cloud-based solution for orders and results, partnerships with diagnostic service providers would be critical. Laboratories, radiology centers and genetic testing facilities were quick to see the benefits of E-Requisitions in addressing inefficiencies at their end too.

We soon realized that Informedika wasn’t just about features – it was about connecting healthcare providers to service providers and to each other in order to make healthcare delivery more effective, and ultimately improve quality of care. So Informedika became the Informedika E-Requisition Network.
